metadata.title: CVE-2020-6572 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Media in Google Chrome prior to 81.0.4044.92 allowed aremote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
